property.name: codeGenerator
property.doc: The code generator to run.

property.name: codeGeneratorClassName
property.doc: The class that is instantiated to execute a particular code generator. This class is expected to be a subclass of ptolemy.copernicus.kernel.KernelMain.

property.name: compile
property.doc: If true, compile the generated code. The default is true.

property.name: show
property.doc: If true, then show the generated code. The default is true.

property.name: run
property.doc: If true, then run the generated code. The default is true.

property.name: ptII
property.doc: The location of the Ptolemy II classes. The default is the value of the ptolemy.ptII.dir java system property

property.name: ptIIUserDirectory
property.doc: The top level directory to write the code in. The default is the value of the ptII parameter. The code will appear in 'ptIIUserDirectory/targetPath'.

property.name: targetPackage
property.doc: The package to generate code in. Defaults to the model name

property.name: targetPath
property.doc: The path relative to the ptIIUserDirectory to generate code in.

property.name: outputDirectory
property.doc: The directory that code will be generated in.

property.name: modelPath
property.doc: The path to the model, including the .xml extension. modelPath is converted to a URL internally before use.

property.name: modelName
property.doc: The name of the model, read from the .xml file and sanitized.

property.name: iterations
property.doc: Number of iterations to run the model for. Usually, the model itself contains the number of iterations to run for. Defaults to 1000.

property.name: iterationsParameter
property.doc: Defaults to "iterations:" + iterations. Set this to the empty string if the model has the number of iterations built in.

property.name: compileOptions
property.doc: User supplied arguments to be passed to the code generator. Defaults to the empty string.

property.name: classPath
property.doc: The class path. Defaults to the value of of the java.class.path property.

property.name: necessaryClasses
property.doc: An array of Strings, where each element names a class that needs to be present in the classpath

property.name: necessaryClassPath
property.doc: Class path that refers to necessary classes. Derived from necessaryClasses

property.name: classPathSeparator
property.doc: The classpath separator. Under Windows, the default is ';'. Under Unix, the default is ':'

property.name: javaHome
property.doc: Defaults to the value of the java.home property

property.name: java
property.doc: Defaults to the value of the java.home property + bin/java, for example: c:/jdk1.3.1/bin/java

property.name: javaPtIIProperty
property.doc: The flag to pass to the java process that defines the value of the ptolemy.ptII.dir property. Defaults to "-Dptolemy.ptII.dir=" + ptII

property.name: javaSystemJar
property.doc: Defaults to the value of the java.home property + "/lib/rt.jar"

property.name: jvmSize
property.doc: The command line arguments to pass to the java interpreter that control the size. The default is -Xmx256m

property.name: templateDirectory
property.doc: The directory for finding template files.

property.name: runCommandTemplateFile
property.doc: The template file that contains the command to run the generated code.

property.name: runOptions
property.doc: User supplied arguments to be passed to the command that will run the generated code. Defaults to the empty string.

property.name: sootDir
property.doc: The directory that contains the soot jar files. Defaults to the value of the ptII parameter + "/lib"

property.name: sootClasses
property.doc: The location of sootclasses.jar, jasminclasses.jar and the Java system jar (usually rt.jar). The necessaryClassPath parameter may end up duplicating some of the elements of this parameter.

property.name: ptIIUserDirectoryAsURL
property.doc: The top level directory to write the code in as a URL. Derived from the value of the ptIIUserDirectory parameter.

property.name: watchDogTimeout
property.doc: The number of milliseconds that code generation will run for. Defaults to 720000, which is 12 minutes.

property.name: output
property.doc: The filename to redirect the standard output stream of the code generator to. This is used, for example, in the nightly build to provide easily parseable error messages. If the value is not set, then the output will not be redirected.
